availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Buchanan (Whitley County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. )

body.p: Whitley County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Tennessee native. Married to Letitia "Letty" Green Buchanan. Father of Nathaniel Buchanan, Juda Buchanan, Lewis Buchanan, Letitita Buchanan, Sarah D. Buchanan, and Henry H. Buchanan. Farmer in Harlan County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Whitley County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Whitley County in 1861. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first sergeant and first lieutenant from March 27, 1862, to June 13, 1863. Died from wounds received at the Battle of Vicksburg on June 13, 1863.
